email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your recent inquiry for a crude oil shipment. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, available for your cargo. The vessel has a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 250 meters. The laycan is October 15-20. The starting freight rate is in the low 50s, say $50.75 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit higher than we were hoping for. Could you consider something in the mid-40s? Also, can you confirm the laytime and demurrage terms? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your concerns about the rate. After discussing with the owner, we can offer a revised rate of $48.50 per metric ton. The laytime is 72 hours, and demurrage is set at $20,000 per day pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised offer. The rate is more in line with our expectations. However, could we push the laycan to October 17-22? Also, can we agree on a demurrage rate of $18,000 per day? Let me know if these adjustments are possible. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I’ve checked with the owner, and we can accommodate the laycan adjustment to October 17-22. However, the demurrage rate is firm at $20,000 per day. The freight rate remains at $48.50 per metric ton. If this works for you, we can proceed with the fixture. Let me know. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the updates. We agree to the terms: freight rate at $48.50 per metric ton, laycan October 17-22, and demurrage at $20,000 per day. Please send over the fixture recap, and we’ll proceed with the formalities. Cheers, John

email_chain.subject: Fixture Recap for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, as discussed, here’s the fixture recap: Vessel: MV Ocean Star, DWT: 150,000, LOA: 250m, Cargo: Crude Oil, Load Port: Rotterdam, Discharge Port: Singapore, Cargo Size: 140,000 MT, Freight Rate: $48.50/MT, Laycan: October 17-22, Demurrage: $20,000/day. Please confirm, and I’ll proceed with the charter party. Best, Sarah
